laboratory_examinations.findings: Total white blood cell count was 8.1 x 10^3/µL (78% neutrophils, 15% lymphocytes, and 7% monocytes).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Increased to 13.3 x 10^3/µL on November 18, 2001, and then to 25.0 x 10^3/µL on November 19, 2001.
Increased to 43 mg/dL (15.4 mmol/L) on November 19, 2001.
Increased to 2.6 mg/dL (230 µmol/L) on November 19, 2001, and further to 3.7 mg/dL (327 µmol/L) between November 19 and 21, 2001.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Initially interpreted as having no evidence of pulmonary infiltrates, widened mediastinum, or pleural effusion.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Subsequent examination suggested possible interval enlargement of the left hilum and a possible small left pleural effusion.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Growth of gram-positive bacilli detected in all 4 blood culture bottles after 14 hours of incubation.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Blood cultures obtained 3 hours after initiation of antibiotics were sterile.

laboratory_examinations.findings: 800 mL of serosanguinous fluid yielded 4224 red blood cells, 1463 white blood cells, pH 7.12, lactate dehydrogenase level 611 U/L, glucose level 259 mg/dL (14.4 mmol/L), protein level 3.4 g/dL. No organisms seen on Gram stain; culture did not grow bacteria.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Subsequent PCR assay was positive for B anthracis.
